messages.text: zip-meta-map: make any repo self-describing for LLMs. Deterministic output, token budgets, CI gating. 246 tests. pip install zip-meta-map

We built zip-meta-map to solve a specific problem: LLM agents need structured repo context, but directory listings waste tokens and drift silently. Our approach is deterministic indexes with CI gating — same repo, same output, every time. 246 tests enforce it.

boilerplate.projectDescription: zip-meta-map is a Python CLI that generates deterministic, JSON Schema-validated indexes of repositories and ZIP archives. It produces structured context for LLM agents with configurable token budgets and CI gating via diff --exit-code. The output is plain JSON consumable by any tool — no vendor lock-in, no runtime dependency.
boilerplate.founderBio: Built by the mcp-tool-shop team — a small group focused on deterministic developer tooling for AI agent infrastructure.

quotes.text: Same repo, same output, every time. That is the entire design contract.
We wrote 246 tests not because we like writing tests, but because determinism demands proof.

comparables.distinction: zip-meta-map produces schema-validated JSON with LLM token budgets and CI-grade diffing, not ad-hoc text output.
Complementary, not competitive. zip-meta-map provides structural metadata; code search provides content retrieval.
